# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Data

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)

Sure! Here is the solution in Julia:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

# Function to add new column for year and month
function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> DateTimeFormat.format("yyyymm")(x), df[:dt])
end

# Given data frame
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])

add_yearmonth(df)
```
This script first defines a function `add_yearmonth` that takes in a DataFrame and adds a new column "ym" by extracting the year and month from the datetime values. 

Then we create a sample dataframe `df`.

Finally, we call our function with our `df` as input to add the new column "ym". The result will be printed at the end of this script.
